title: Targeting Epigenetic and miRNA Regulation of IL-17 Pathways in Rheumatoid Arthritis
text: We hypothesize that novel therapeutic approaches which modulate epigenetic histone acetylation and microRNA-mediated regulation of IL17A/IL17F expression can alter transcription factor activity and downstream cytokine signaling. This integrated modulation may attenuate oxidative stress-induced NF-kB activation, reducing IL-17‐driven inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis.

mechanistic_summaries.path_summary: Modulation of Interleukin-17 (IL-17) pathways in autoimmune disorders through epigenetic and microRNA regulation leading to inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis

key_entities.definition: Novel therapeutic approaches involve innovative strategies for treating diseases, which may include new drug formulations, gene therapy, or regenerative medicine methods aiming to improve patient outcomes and efficacy beyond traditional therapies.

Interleukin-17 (IL-17) pathways play a crucial role in the immune response and are implicated in the pathogenesis of various autoimmune disorders, including rheumatoid arthritis and multiple sclerosis.

IL17A and IL17F are receptors for major effector cytokines of the immune system involved in antimicrobial host defense and tissue integrity, enhancing neutrophil activation and regulating B cell responses to infections.

Multidomain protein that regulates epigenetic modifications, important for histone acetylation and DNA methylation. It binds to hemimethylated DNA and recruits various chromatin modifiers, impacting transcription and DNA repair.

key_entities.entity: microRNAs (miRNAs) associated with immune response regulation
key_entities.definition: MicroRNAs (miRNAs) are small non-coding RNAs that regulate gene expression and play critical roles in immune response regulation, influencing various cellular processes involved in inflammation, differentiation, and pathogen response.

key_entities.entity: transcription factors involved in immune cell differentiation
key_entities.definition: MTOR is a serine/threonine protein kinase that centrally regulates cellular metabolism, growth, and survival in response to various signals, playing a vital role in immune cell differentiation by modulating transcription factors and protein synthesis pathways.

key_entities.entity: cytokine signaling pathways crucial for rheumatologic conditions
key_entities.definition: Cytokine signaling pathways are crucial for the regulation of immune responses, promoting inflammation and hematopoietic cell differentiation. These pathways influence conditions like rheumatoid arthritis by affecting chemokine release and immune cell function.

A signaling pathway involved in regulating immune response, inflammation, and cell survival, transmitted by the NF-kB protein complex, crucial for the activation of genes responsible for these processes.

relationships.interpretation: Influence on IL-17 pathways in autoimmune disorders

references.title: MOG(35-55) i.v suppresses experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis partially through modulation of Th17 and JAK/STAT pathways.
references.snippet: MOG i.v. treatment led to significantly lower production of IL-17, and suppression of JAK/STAT pathways associated with immune tolerance.

references.title: Aristolochic acid IVa ameliorates arthritis in SKG Mice by regulating macrophage polarization and Th17/Treg balance.
references.snippet: AAIVa induced M2 macrophage polarization and decreased Th17 cells, suggesting a regulatory effect on IL-17 pathways in autoimmune arthritis.

references.title: Involvement of the IL23/Th17 Pathway in the Pathogenesis of Tunisian Pemphigus Foliaceus
references.snippet: Genetic associations between SNPs in IL17A and IL17F and the susceptibility to Pemphigus Folaceus were reported, implicating the IL17 pathway in autoimmune disorders.

references.title: The role of IL-23/IL-17 axis in human kidney allograft rejection
references.snippet: This study highlights the involvement of IL-17A and genetic variations in IL17A and IL17F genes in the context of transplant rejection, illustrating their role in autoimmune processes.

references.title: IL-17A, IL-23R, FCGR3A are associated with neuropsychiatric systemic lupus erythematosus susceptibility in pediatric patients with lupus nephritis
references.snippet: Three significant SNPs in IL17A, IL17F, and IL23R genes were identified to influence susceptibility to systemic lupus erythematosus, linking genetic variations to IL-17 pathway involvement.

relationships.interpretation: Regulation of gene expression by epigenetic modifications

references.title: The immunomodulatory effects of TNF-α inhibitors on human Th17 cells via RORγt histone acetylation.
references.snippet: Epigenetic modifications, including histone acetylation, regulate gene expression in RA pathogenesis.

references.title: Increased expression of TLR2 in CD4(+) T cells from SLE patients enhances immune reactivity and promotes IL-17 expression through histone modifications.
references.snippet: TLR2 activation upregulated H3K4 tri-methylation and H4 acetylation levels while downregulated H3K9 tri-methylation level in the IL-17A promoter region.

relationships.relation: can be influenced by the activity of
relationships.target: microRNAs (miRNAs) associated with immune response regulation
relationships.interpretation: Modulation of epigenetic modifications by miRNAs

references.title: The Effects of Environmental Exposure on Epigenetic Modifications in Allergic Diseases.
references.snippet: Changes in histone acetylation of proinflammatory genes and in the expression of certain microRNAs are associated with the response to inhaled corticosteroids in asthma.

references.title: Systematic analysis reveals key microRNAs as diagnostic and prognostic factors in progressive stages of lung cancer
references.snippet: These key microRNAs also impact the survival risk of lung adenocarcinoma patients at all (or a specific) stage(s) and some of them target important Transcription Factors.

references.title: Epigenetic Dynamics of Cell Reprogramming
references.snippet: Reprogramming is a non-equilibrium process involving transcription factor binding/unbinding, protein synthesis/degradation, and epigenetic histone modification.

relationships.source: microRNAs (miRNAs) associated with immune response regulation
relationships.target: transcription factors involved in immune cell differentiation
relationships.interpretation: Targeting of transcription factors by miRNAs

references.title: A secreted helminth microRNA suppresses gastrointestinal cell differentiation required for innate immunity.
references.snippet: This study shows that secreted helminth miRNA (miR-5352) represses critical host factors, including Klf-4, which is involved in immune responses, demonstrating direct targeting by miRNAs.

references.title: Placental mesenchymal stem cell-derived exosomes treat endometrial injury in a rat model of intrauterine adhesions.
references.snippet: Results indicated that miR-143 delivered via exosomes targeted MyD88, influencing pathways crucial for immune modulation.

relationships.source: transcription factors involved in immune cell differentiation
relationships.target: cytokine signaling pathways crucial for rheumatologic conditions
relationships.interpretation: Interaction between transcription factors and cytokine signaling pathways

references.title: Genetic analysis of differentiation of T-helper lymphocytes
references.snippet: The intracellular signaling pathways of differentiation form a dynamic regulation network by secreting distinctive types of cytokines, while differentiation is regulated by two major gene loci: T-bet and GATA-3.

references.title: Sepsis is a syndrome with hyperactivity of TH17-like innate immunity and hypoactivity of adaptive immunity
references.snippet: Hyperimmune theory suggests that cytokine storm causes the symptoms of sepsis, indicating a crucial interaction between immune response and cytokine signaling.

relationships.source: cytokine signaling pathways crucial for rheumatologic conditions
relationships.relation: modulated by oxidative stress through the activation of
relationships.target: NF-kB pathway, contributing to inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis
relationships.interpretation: NF-kB pathway activation leading to inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis

references.title: Mangiferin exert protective effects on joints of adjuvant-induced arthritis rats by regulating the MAPKs/NF-κB pathway of fibroblast-like synoviocytes.
references.snippet: The mechanistic analysis demonstrated that MF might exert an antiarthritic effect via inhibiting the pathway of MAPKs (ERK2 and p38) and NF-κB.

references.title: Regulation of Dendritic Cell Function by Ermiaosan via the EP4-cAMP-CREB Signaling Pathway
references.snippet: Mechanistically, EMS alleviates RA by inhibiting the EP4-cAMP pathway and reducing oxidative stress, which is associated with inflammation.

messages.content:
Title: Targeting Epigenetic and miRNA Regulation of IL-17 Pathways in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Statement: We hypothesize that novel therapeutic approaches which modulate epigenetic histone acetylation and microRNA-mediated regulation of IL17A/IL17F expression can alter transcription factor activity and downstream cytokine signaling. This integrated modulation may attenuate oxidative stress-induced NF-kB activation, reducing IL-17‐driven inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis.
